intro: Cathaya nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan cathaya, is a rare and ancient gymnosperm species native to China. It is a member of the family Taxaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cone-like structures and scale-like leaves. The plant is notable for its primitive features, which provide valuable insights into the evolution of conifers. It is typically found in mountainous regions with cool, humid climates, growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cathaya nanchuanensis is considered a critically endangered species.
